definition: to enclose/to cover with the hand (one's eyes, nose or ears)/to cover up (an affair)/contrary/to contradict
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
to cover the face/to bury one's face in one's hands

sentences.english: Use a wet towel to cover your mouth and nose.
sentences.chinese: 用湿毛巾捂住嘴巴和鼻子。

sentences.english: My friend was on her feet now, with one unbelieving hand against her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友不禁站起身，惊讶得用手捂住了嘴巴。

sentences.english: She covered her mouth with her hand, another wave of chills flowing over her as her knees literally knocked together.
sentences.chinese: 她用手捂住嘴，又一阵恶寒让她全身发抖，膝盖打颤。

sentences.english: She huddles against the seat. Clamps her hand over her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 她缩回到座位上，用手紧紧地捂住自己的嘴。

sentences.english: Hester's first motion had been to cover her bosom with her clasped hands.
sentences.chinese: 海丝特的第一个动作就是想用合着的双手来捂住胸膛。

sentences.english: Place a hand in front of your mouth when sneezing so that your soul cannot escape.
sentences.chinese: 打喷嚏的时候，用手捂住你的嘴，可以防止灵魂外逃。

sentences.english: I pulled the hatpin out and held my handkerchief over the bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 我把那针拔下来，用我的手绢捂住她流血的地方。

sentences.english: Scarlett clapped a hand over the blubbery mouth.
sentences.chinese: 思嘉一手把那张哭嚷的嘴捂住了。

sentences.english: He coved his face with his hands, and pouted.
sentences.chinese: 他用手捂住脸，不说话了。

sentences.english: He suggested they cover their mouths with damp handkerchiefs.
sentences.chinese: 久保木建议他们用潮湿的手帕将嘴捂住。

sentences.english: Ilsa shivers . Then suddenly, she breaks down, covering her face with her hands. Rick walks to her.
sentences.chinese: 伊尔莎颤抖起来，她忽然垮下来，用手捂住脸哭了。

sentences.english: "oh, dear ! "She cried , clapping a hand over her mouth.
sentences.chinese: “哎呀，”她嚷叫道，突然用手捂住嘴。

sentences.english: When she covered her face with her hands, streaks of acid ran down her fingers and onto her forearms.
sentences.chinese: 她用手捂住脸，硫酸又流到她的手指和前臂上。

sentences.english: His face was nuzzled into his hands.
She put her hands on his temples and blew in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她双手捂住他的太阳穴，对着他的眼睛吹气。

definition: to enclose/to cover with the hand (one's eyes, nose or ears)/to cover up (an affair)/contrary/to contradict
mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
